text: Hi! I’m Jordi, a postdoc researcher at Utrecht University (Netherlands). I’m starting a new project where I aim at using Universal Differential Equations (UDEs) to model the impact of climate change on glaciers at a global scale. DiffEqFlux.jl is the reason I’m moving from Python to Julia :smile:

elements.text: Hi! I’m Jordi, a postdoc researcher at Utrecht University (Netherlands). I’m starting a new project where I aim at using Universal Differential Equations (UDEs) to model the impact of climate change on glaciers at a global scale. DiffEqFlux.jl is the reason I’m moving from Python to Julia

text: Welcome. You also might want to join <#CNK8SLW58|climate> and <#C9XBLUCVB|geo>. What data are you using for your analysis?

elements.text: Welcome. You also might want to join
. What data are you using for your analysis?

text:
Thanks! <@U69BL50BF> your UDE paper and SciML tutorials have been truly inspirational. Extremely well explained and informative. Keep up the good work!

<@UBG5JAHS7>: Thanks! I’ll use remote sensing data (altimetry, surface velocities), field data (glacier measurements) and climate reanalyses (CRU or ERA5).
